newsitem.title: USA: CBOE to trade options on ADR, 10 stocks on April 1.
newsitem.headline: CBOE to trade options on ADR, 10 stocks on April 1.

text.p: The Chicago Board Options Exchange will trade options on 10 stocks and on the American Depositary Receipts of CBT Group Plc on Tuesday, April 1, the exchange said.

CBT, based in Dublin, Ireland, develops and publishes interactive software for business education and training. Options on its ADRs will trade on the February expiration cycle, with initial strike prices at 40, 45 and 50.
Options on Alliance Capital Management, Cardio Thoracic Systems Inc, Cliffs Drilling Co and Florida Panthers Holdings Inc will also be listed.
Alliance is an investment adviser located in New York. Options on Alliance will trade on the January expiration cycle, with initial strike prices at 22-1/2, 25 and 30.

Cardio of Cupertino, Calif., develops disposable instruments and systems for some cardiothoracic surgical procedures. Its options will trade on the March expiration cycle, with initial strike prices at 17-1/2, 20 and 22-1/2.
Cliffs Drilling, headquartered in Houston, Texas, drills offshore for oil and gas. Options on Cliffs will trade on the February expiration cycle, with initial strike prices at 50, 55 and 60.
Florida Panthers through the Florida Panthers Hockey Club Ltd owns the Florida Panthers hockey team. Options will trade on the January expiration cycle, with initial strike prices at 25, 30 and 35.
The CBOE will also list options on Physio-Control International Corp, Reliance Acceptance Corp, Sangstat Medical Corp, Synovus Financial Corp, Ugly Duckling Corp and Young Broadcasting Inc.

Physio-Control of Redmond, Wash., makes noninvasive emergency cardiac defibrillator and vital signs devices. Its options will trade on the March expiration cycle, with strike prices at 12-1/2, 15 and 17-1/2.
Reliance, headquartered in Wheeling, Ill., is a financial services company. Options will trade on the March cycle, with strike prices at 7-1/2, 10 and 12-1/2.
Sangstat of Menlo Park, Calif., develops products to improve the outcome of organ transplants. Its options will trade on the January cycle, with strike prices at 25, 30 and 35.
Synovus, headquartered in Columbus, Ga., is a multi-financial bank holding company. Options for Synovus will trade on the February cycle, with strike prices at 30, 35 and 40.
Ugly Duckling, headquartered in Phoenix, Ariz., operates a chain of used-car dealerships. Options for Ugly Duckling will trade on the March cycle, with strike prices at 15, 17-1/2 and 20.

Young Broadcasting of New York owns and operates television stations. Its options will trade on the January cycle and strike prices will initially be set at 25, 30 and 35. ((Derivatives desk 312-408-8750))E-mail derivatives@reuters.com
